bug.author: xaniasd
bug.summary: Cannot configure ambassador parameters on minikube
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Attempted to deploy Kubeflow on minikube, with Ambassador. The created service for the latter is configurable (default ClusterIP), howerver I could not influence the generated output. The snippet below should configure a NodePort service, but the generated code did not reflect the change. componentParams: ambassador: - name: ambassadorServiceType value: NodePort What did you expect to happen: Ambassador should have been deployed with a NodePort service instead of ClusterIP.
I believe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/blob/master/pkg/kfapp/minikube/minikube.go#L103>this</denchmark-link> part of the code is to blame, as it overwrites the Ambassador component parameters with hard-coded values. Environment:
Kubeflow version: v0.6.1 kfctl version: 3a1eb06 (master) Kubernetes platform: minikube Kubernetes version: v1.14.3 OS: Ubuntu 18.04.3
